comments:
When I started up my workbench this morning and tried to synchronize a project
(org.eclipse.jdt.core) that I'd grabbed from the dev.eclipse.org repository, I
got an error message telling me that the project wasn't managed by CVS. As a
sanity check, I tried to bring up the project's properties and double-check the
"CVS" page. However, clicking on the CVS page yielded the following NPE:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteLocation(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:133)
	at
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSPropertiesPage.initializeValues(CVSPropertiesPage.java:214)

	at
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.SelectableItemWidget$1.handleEvent(SelectableItemWidget.java:1190)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java:488)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1561)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1403)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:538)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:525)
	at org.eclipse.ui.dialogs.PropertyDialogAction.run(PropertyDialogAction.java:150)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.Action.runWithEvent(Action.java:473)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetSelection(ActionContributionItem.java:407)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.handleWidgetEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:361)

org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.access$0(ActionContributionItem.java:352)

org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$ActionListener.handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:47)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.notifyListeners(Widget.java:488)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1561)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1403)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:722)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:705)

sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

Is there anything else you can think of that will help us narrow it down?
The line where it failed has a number of potential failure cases.

Also, were you in the packages view when you checked the CVS properties?  There 
is a bug in JDT/Desktop whereby the properties get contributed for non CVS 
projects.  If you got the properties from the Navigator that would tell us your 
project still had a CVS nature but just no longer had an association to the 
repository somehow.
I was in the packages view.

You wouldn't happen to have the project still around? If so, could you zip it 
up and attach it so we can see what the sync info looks like?
Sorry, I deleted it so I could get on with my work.
